titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Frederick Russell Burnham Papers, 1879-1979

Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, clippings, other printed matter, photographs, and memorabilia, relating to the Matabele Wars of 1893 and 1896 in Rhodesia, the Boer War, exploration expeditions in Africa, and gold mining in Alaska duing the Klondike gold rush.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Frederick Russell Burnham Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Introduction
bioghist.p: Born in the USA Burnham was brought up in California. He received a limited formal education but in the course of his early working life in the Western USA he acquired a knowledge of mining, particularly gold mining. From 1893 to 1897 he was in present-day Zimbabwe and Zambia. It was he who led the Northern Territories (BSA) Exploration Co. expedition which established for the outside world that major copper deposits existed in Central Africa.

In 1897 Burnham left Africa to take up gold mining in Alaska and the Klondike but in 1900 he returned to become the chief scout of the British forces engaged in the Boer War. In 1901, having been wounded, he left South Africa for London. There he was employed by the Wa Syndicate. For the Wa Syndicate he led an expedition through Ghana and Upper Volta which was concerned both with mineral occurrences and the possibility of improving the navigability of major rivers. He also served the Wa Syndicate as their London office manager.

From 1902 to 1904 Burnham was employed by the East Africa Syndicate. For them he led a mineral prospecting expedition which travelled extensively in the area around Lake Rudolph. Thereafter he was engaged in projects in the Americas for, or in cojunction with, John Hays Hammond, the mining magnate. During the 1920s and 1930s Burnham was engaged in the management of the Dominguez oilfield in California.

The papers of Frederick Burnham are not all in one place. One stray item is in the National Archives of Zimbabwe1. The remainder are split between Yale University Library2 and the Hoover Institution's Archives. The papers at Yale University were gifted by Major Burnham's widow in 1951. Those at the Hoover Institution she gifted in 1978. Whilst most of those gifted to Yale are subject to a closure which renders them inaccessible until the year 20003, those at the Hoover Institution are open. The latter contain a substantial number of transcripts, that is to say copies laboriously made by hand from diaries, letters, etc. the originals of which are (in most cases, at least) now at Yale. One file of correspondence at the Hoover Institution Archives contains both transcripts and the originals from which they were copied4: the transcripts are highly accurate. That the same is true of the other transcripts at the Hoover Institution can not, however, be guaranteed. Whilst some papers are in both repositories (the originals at Yale and the transcipts at the Hoover Institution) this is by no means the whole picture. Some papers at Yale (on mines in Chile and China, for instance) are not duplicated in the papers at the Hoover Institution. Vice versa, some materials at the Hoover Institution are not duplicates of papers at Yale.

note.label: Footnotes
note.p: 1. Baxter, T.W. and Burke, E.E. Guide to the Historical Manuscripts in the National Archives of Rhodesia, 1970, p.67.
2. Yale University Library, Manuscripts and Archives, New Haven, Connecticut 06520.
3. A collection of writings about Burnham and working papers for his two books Scouting on Two Continents (1928) and Taking Chances (1944) are open for research use.
4. Folder Lummis, Charles F., Folder 10 in Box 3.

chronitem.event: Born, Tivoli, Minnesota
Family moved to Los Angeles
Cowboy, hunter, prospector and scout in Arizona and Texas
Marriage to Blanche Blick
Trooper in BSA Police, Rhodesia [Zimbabwe]
Prospecting in North West Rhodesia [Western Zambia]
Scout for British forces in Matabele [Ndebele] wars
Gold mining in Alaska and Klondike
Chief Scout of British forces in Boer War
Awarded Distinguished Service Order
Working for Wa Syndicate in Gold Coast [Ghana] and London
Working for East Africa Syndicate. Led mineral prospecting expedition to Lake Rudolph
Engaged in irrigation project in Yacqui River Delta, Mexico
Director of Yacqui Delta Land and Water Co.
Manager of manganese and tungsten survey of Western USA
Manager of Burnham Exploration Co. [later Dominguez Oil Fields Co.]
Burnham Exploration Co. and Union Oil Co. agreed to develop Dominguez Oilfield on a 50:50 basis
Author, Scouting on Two Continents
Director of Union Oil Co.
Death of Mrs Blanche Burnham
Marriage to Ilo K. Willits [or Ferrce]
Author, Taking Chances
Died, California

scopecontent.p: Biographical data and writings, a family tree, correspondence, clippings and publications.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, notes and clippings re Burnham and Russell family history. Photographic materials were removed from this file and placed in envelope J, 78082-10.A-V.
Notes and clippings re Frederick R. Burnham
Britt, Albert, The Boy's Own Book of Adventurers, 1923
Davis, Richard Harding, Real Soldiers of Fortune, 1907. See also correspondence with Davis (Box 2 Folder 10 below)
Goodland, Colonel H.T., Hail and Farewell, 1948
Lang, Andrew, The Red True Story Book, 1921
Russell, Charles Edward, A Pioneer Editor in Early Iowa, 1941
West, James E. and Lamb, Peter O., He Who Sees in the Dark, 1932
West, James E. (Compiler), The Boy Scout's Book of True Adventure, 1931
S.J. Clarke Publishing Co., California of the South, a History, vol. 41933

scopecontent.p: Correspondence and transcripts of correspondence of Frederick R. and Ilo K. Burnham, arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

Subjects include: Bardeen Oil Trust; Western USA irrigation and dam schemes
Subjects include: travels around Lake Rudolph, East Africa, 1903; expedition to Tibet, 1905-1908

did.unittitle: Burnham, Mrs. Blanche B., 1890-1892. Letters to Mrs. Burnham in California from her husband in Colorado and Missouri
City of Bulawayo, Southern Rhodesia (Zimbabwe), 1946-1963. Invitations to formal occasions

scopecontent.p: Subjects include copyright on Burnham's book Taking Chances

scopecontent.p: Subjects include wars in Rhodesia (Zimbabwe) and South Africa. Contains agreement between Frederick R. Burnham, Hon. Maurice Gifford and Pearl Ingram and Lord Gifford and F.I. Ricarde-Deaver for the exploitation of a concession in Rhodesia
Subjects include Redwoods Preservation League
Subjects include: possible film of Burnham's book Scouting on Two Continents; rifle training for Boy Scouts
Subjects include Frederick R. Burnham's activities on behalf of J.H. Hammond in Mexico and the USA

Subjects include: Burnham Exploration Co.; Colorado River Valley Development; develpment of the gas lift method of oil extraction; Dominguez Oil Field; land dealings; Hammond's campaign to become Secretary for the Interior; Union Oil Co.; Yacqui Delta Land and Water Co., Mexico
Subjects include: preservation of California's wildlife; public relations aspects of Yacqui Delta developments; publishing propositions
Subjects include: American and British politics; World War One
Subjects include publication of Burnham's book Taking Chances
Subjects include Southwest Society (of the) Archaeological Society of America. See also Box 3 Folder 6 below
Subjects include development of irrigation crops

Subjects include gift of the Macomber collection of artefacts from Africa and Oceania to Arizona State Museum. Contains report on Black Bear gold mine prepared by Frederick R. Burnham, 1915. See also Box 3 Folder 19 below

did.unittitle: The Outpost (Regimental Magazine of the British South Africa Police), 1941-1947

scopecontent.p: Subjects include Society of Members of the 1893 Columns, Rhodesia (Zimbabwe)

scopecontent.p: Subjects include proposal to form an American volunteer force to fight against Germany, 1917. See also Box 4 Folder 1 below

Subjects include: Arizona State Museum's Macomber Collection; Frederick R. Burnham's early life in California and other Western states; game ranching; State Parks. Most speeches delivered to Sunsetters Club, Los Angeles

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: hanting, mining, prospecting and scouting in the USA and Africa; proposal to form an American volunteer force to fight against Germany; Theodore Roosevelt, 1920s-1940s
Notebooks containing transcripts of correspondence, agreements, diaries and reports, arranged by provenance of documents transcribed.

did.unittitle: Transcripts of agreements, correspondence and reports.

Transcripts of letters sent by Frederick R. Burnham to Northern Territories (BSA) Exploration Co., H. Greene and Lord Gifford re business transactions including land deals, mineral developments and Northern Rhodesian (Zambian) concessions, 1897
Transcripts of correspondence, orders and reports, 1900-1905.

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: Boer War; East Africa Syndicate
The memoirs concern Earl Grey, Sir H. Rider Haggard and E.H. Harriman. Subjects of the correspondence include the oil extraction industry in California

did.unittitle: Transcripts of diaries kept by A. King Macomber, John Blick (?) Gillfillan and (?) Stewart whilst mineral prospecting in Northern Rhodesia (Zambia) for the Northern Territories (BSA) Exploration Co., 1895. Minerals mentioned include copper, gold and salt
Transcripts of diary kept by John Blick whilst on Wa Syndicate expedition in Gold Coast (Ghana), 1901.

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: gold deposits; possibility of improving the navigability of inland waterways. Contains an account of North Eastern Hausaland taken down in writing by John Blick from one of his porters

did.unittitle: Alaska and Klondike, 1899-1936. Transcripts of correspondence, working papers for a publication and printed ephemera. Photographic materials were removed from this file and placed in envelope G, 78082-10.A-V.

164 prints depicting East African scenes, people and mineral occurrences, mostly Nairobi and vicinity of lake Rudolph
18 prints depicting Rhodesian (Zimbabwean) scenes, including Great Zimbabwe
23 prints depicting South African and Rhodesian (Zimbabwean) scenes, including commemoration ceremonies for the 1893 pioneer columns in Rhodesia (Zimbabwe).
7 prints depicting an exhibition of the Howell Wright Collection of Rhodesiana and South Africana in Cleveland public library prior to its presentation to Yale University Library.
145 prints depicting scenes, people, mineral occurrences and military forces in Golf Coast (Ghana) and Upper Volta, including Kintampo market women and villages destroyed by Samori.
14 prints depicting houses, street scenes and local scenery in and around Skagway, Alaska
3 prints with one related press clipping depicting Tibet and/or Western China, taken by Jack Brooke.
24 prints and 1 sketch depicting Frederick R. Burnham.
20 prints depicting members of the Burnham and Russell families and their automobiles.
35 prints depicting members of Frederick R. Burnham's family in Alaska, Britain, California and East Africa.
15 prints depicting Frederick R. Burnham's early homes in California
53 prints depicting Frederick R. Burnham's Hollywood homes, including trophies and other memorabilia collected whilst travelling.
17 prints depicting Frederick R. Burnham's homes and grave.
39 prints depicting Frederick R. Burnham's personal friends and their homes.
10 prints, no common factor, 1870s-1940s, including 1870 lynching in Los Angeles, 190? inscribed stone, Yacqui Valley, Mexico, 1938 Dominguez Oilfield.
25 negatives depicting Frederick R. Burnham's Hollywood homes
3 negatives depicting a group including W. Glenn Campbell outside Stanford University Faculty Club.
61 postcards and 1 Christmas card depicting Alaska Rhodesia and other subjects.
31 prints depicting one of Frederick R. Burnham's Hollywood homes.
3 prints and 2 cartoons, no common factor, 1900-1939, including , 1938-1939 Sunset Club Christmas dinner parties, 1939 Kofa Mountain Game Range, Arizona.
album containing 20 prints depicting one of Frederick R. Burnham's California Homes
23 slides depicting Frederick R. Burnham, one of his homes and a Boy Scout memorial to him
